website_summaries.verdict: This mixer is a little smaller size, but is strong and has a large capacity bowl.
pros: Comes with a splatter shield and non-stick attachments
Slightly smaller footprint than other Hamilton Beach mixers
Non-skid feet help keep the mixer stable
cons: The beater doesn't always scrape the side of the bowl well enough to completely eliminate the need for a spatula

website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive mixer with a smaller 4-quart bowl capacity and basic functions that suit the average baker or cook. The best all-around contender if you are looking for a stand mixer under $100.
pros: Seven speeds and a helpful QuickBurst button
cons: Attachments don't always scrape the bottom of the bowl, leaving some material unmixed
Small bowl size may be frustrating for some

customer_reviews.title: Does as good a job as the competition at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a mixer to make a large batch of gingerbread men and this mixer is up to the job. My sister said I would have to knead in the last bit of dry ingredients by hand because the stand mixer wouldn't be able to do that. She was wrong and I am glad she was. Mixing thicker dough by hand is quite tiring. The only con I could find was the attachments did have trouble pulling ingredients from the sides of the bowl falling short by about a 1/4 inch. Just keep a rubber scraper on hand to help the mixer along occasionally until all the thicker/stickier ingredients blend in.
customer_reviews.author: J. Childress

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome stand mixer for the price. I have had a KitchenAid but gave it to my daughter when I downsized thinking I could get away with just a stand mixer. Guess Again! I really missed my stand mixer but didn't want to pay the big bucks again. After reading many reviews I decided to go with this one and I'm happy I did. It is quite simple to use and it works great. I have used it for cookies, biscuits and banana bread and all turned out excellent. Love a great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: StonefordMama

customer_reviews.title: Makes me want to bake more!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad we purchased this! Just used it today, trying the sugar cookie recipe in the back of the manual. Wow! This thing creamed cold butter in no time and the cookies made my husband's eyes roll to the back of his head! I'm sold! I think I'll be baking more because I have a great tool to do so!
customer_reviews.author: ButterflyLady

customer_reviews.title: Nice mixer for price, good weight for lifting
customer_reviews.text: Not a heavy mixer to lift. Does its job well. I wash blades by hand after reading too many reviews of all brand mixer blades having the finish come off in dishwasher. Mixer suction cups hold well to our Italian slate countertops and stay in place during mixing on high speeds or dense ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle K

customer_reviews.title: IT GET'S THE JOB DONE
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted a stand mixer, but they are always so much money. Decided to give this one a try and I'm now happy mixing and baking away. It's not as heavy duty as the more expensive ones, but it hasn't stopped me from making all sorts of things. Thanks Hamilton Beach, I owe you some home made chocolate chip cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Not for the baker who is serious
customer_reviews.text: This is fine if you don't bake in large quantities. It is noisy, but the comments about mixer not hitting the bottom were not valid in my case. It does a great job, it's just smaller than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy and Smarter choice
customer_reviews.text: I was about to make a mistake and return. I researched further about KA and after making cookies in no time, I decided to keep my purchase. Also, it's Great for limited counter top space with a 300W engine. I will re-update as I get to my bread recipes. Great warranty as well, better than KA.
customer_reviews.author: G.P

customer_reviews.title: Don't even bother if you want to make bread
customer_reviews.text: I have had this one day. One single day. And I am already going to be on the phone with Amazon to return this thing. The bread hook is entirely incapable of getting anywhere near the bottom of the bowl, it does not mix thoroughly, and frankly my disabled grandma can exert more force on bread dough than this bloody mixer can. Even with more than ample time to work the dough, it completely failed to knead it and properly build the gluten structure, ruining the loaves. It's disappointing to say the least, avoid at all costs. All reviews rating this five stars are, in my opinion, fairly suspect. Just go buy a Kitchenaid.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Dough Mixer
customer_reviews.text: The third time I tried to use the stand mixer to knead the bread dough with the dough hook, it stopped turning after about 3 minutes. Sounded like the gear is stripped and could only turn without the dough in the bowl. Plastic parts . . . maybe?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazed...
customer_reviews.text: This is my very first stand mixer and I am glad I came across this one on Amazon, especially reading all the reviews. I liked the sturdy attachments, very easy to clean. I was also satisfied with the price deal I used. I been mixing my CPS lunchroom butter cookies by hand until now and I can't believe I did not have to! One complaint I do have is the very short cord, as my counter is very small and the oulet already occupied by heavy microwave. Overall, those cookies turned out GREAT... Nice and buttery. Nice price, invest in one!
customer_reviews.author: B. A.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Returned item because it would not mix completely even after several minutes on various speeds.
customer_reviews.author: jwm

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is fine for the casual baker. Box mixes, cake batter, brownie batter are all fine. It struggles a little bit with heavier cookie dough but still gets the job done. If you make buttercream frosting on a regular basis then this isn't for you in my opinion. I like that everything can go in the dishwasher, but the whisk has a plastic component holding it together that makes me nervous regarding durability. I do find the button mechanism annoying that's used to release the top. It just seems a little clunky to me. I guess that I just got used to the lever on my Kitchen Aid.
customer_reviews.author: E Spurling

customer_reviews.title: good price and product
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. I wasn't about to spend $$$ on a kitchen aid for as infrequently as I use it - but when my hand mixer died I wanted a bit more. I've made several cookies and cakes, including a dense poundcake, since I got it a few weeks ago and have been very pleased! It is plastic, but the suction keeps it to the counter well.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Better than a hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: It's no kitchen aid. But it's much better than a hand mixer. So for someone who doesn't need a heavy duty mixer, someone who will make cookies it works pretty good. I've noticed that the space between the beater and the bowl is a bit too wide. I have to stop and scrape down the butter/sugar when I add my first couple of eggs. A bit of an annoyance, but for a couple hundred bucks less, I don't mind.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barker

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: does not work any more after just using one time
customer_reviews.author: weiyukan

customer_reviews.title: ... want to spend the dollar amount that the very nice stand mixers cost
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a stand mixer but didn't want to spend the dollar amount that the very nice stand mixers cost. I read the reviews on this one and decided to give it a try. I'm very pleased with its performance when I mix a cookie dough or something stiff that needs to have more power than a handheld mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy V

customer_reviews.title: My fiance loved it !
customer_reviews.text: The Mixer is very powerful and does a very good job mixing all kind of ingredients. Christmas baking fas more fun and less pain thanks to this !
customer_reviews.author: Sridhar Mane

customer_reviews.title: Wisk broken after 3rd use.
customer_reviews.text: Whenever we use it, the dry ingredients just get shoved to the sides of the bowl and we have to try to push it all to the middle while it's still running. The wisk also broke apart after it's 3rd use.
customer_reviews.author: Madron

customer_reviews.title: bowl lock broke
customer_reviews.text: after two months of occasional use one of the tabs on base that locks the bowl broke off during kneading ... otherwise, the product was easy to use and clean and i liked it ... will make a warranty claim with manufacturer
customer_reviews.author: Pila

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I’m changing my first review. I was disappointed to see that you can only use “THE” bowl sent. I see no replacements. I had a great Sunbeam for years. I felt it the best. I have now bonded with my Hamilton Beach 63390 and used it to mix cookie dough. This mixer rocks! I love it. I wish they would sell the bowls so I could have two for easier mixing.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Loving this mixer so far. Baked a delicious cake for my family this weekend. The machine did a wonderful​ job mixing all the ingredients and reaching the bottom and sides of the bowl with very little help from a spatula. I also made a whipped cream frosting and it turned out perfect! Good alternative without having to spend hundreds of dollars. Overall, I'm extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer, not so much for Bread dough
customer_reviews.text: I used this and it works good but, it seems to strain with bread dough, if you don't do a lot of bread it would be a great mixer. I generally like Hamilton Beach, they do make good products. I owned a wand mixer of theirs for years.
customer_reviews.author: Equate Null

customer_reviews.title: Very good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Works very well, and good enough for my needs. Its my first machine, so I cannot compare to anything else, but for the price it is excellent. I did buy the 3 year warranty though, and that's because I do not know it.. Peace of mind :-) All in all I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: MAGNUM-SHOK INC

customer_reviews.title: Not convenient  to use!
customer_reviews.text: My wife HATES this mixer!!! It is not easy or convent to use. The splattshield needs to be used, otherwise it will fling food out od the bowl. The opening in the splatter sheild is not large enough to add ingredients thruwhile mixer is running, so you must remove the shield and raise the beater each time you add an ingredient. Wiah we could return it!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me but, I'm not a super user. Made some tasty pizza dough with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Smith

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t be happier!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to get a KitchenAid mixer for years but couldn’t afford it. After days of research I decided to purchase this and I absolutely could not be happier with my purchase. It works great it’s easy to clean and I’m so happy that I have it. You do have to scrape the bottom and I don’t even care. That is a small price to pay to have a mixer.
customer_reviews.author: angechriswalt

customer_reviews.title: Managed bread very well.
customer_reviews.text: It is wonderful. We have already used it quite a few times. Cake batter turned out perfect in no time. The real test was the bread dough, the hook went all the way to the bottom while kneading and the motor did not seem to struggle with it. Easy to clean. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jean McCullough

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy good mixer
customer_reviews.text: For many years I did without a mixer, using a hand styled one. I bought this because I do not bake a lot, but enough to need one. I use this one often. It is easy to use, works well, the suction on the counter is great and my baking has never been better. Glad I did not buy the more expensive blender. This one serves my purposes well, works well and I am totally happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Stubbeman

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of KitchenAid mixers. However, my next mixer needed to be lightweight and smaller to allow me to carry it in luggage to Mexico. This unit is wonderful. I have used it for cakes, cookies, bread, and mashed potatoes. It has performed flawlessly. The only slight negative that I have is that the bottom of the mixing bowl is not mixed as well as I'm used too. So during the mix I stop and use a spatula to ensure the bottom layer (about 1/2 inch) is incorporated.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbobamatic

customer_reviews.title: The WORST product I have bought online
customer_reviews.text: The WORST product I have bought online, it broke and no longer mixes after only one use. Literally cant mix warmed cream cheese.
customer_reviews.author: David Crittendon

customer_reviews.title: It is good for what I need for making dough for
customer_reviews.text: the hook for dough could be longer to touch the bottom of the bowl. It is good for what I need for making dough for bread
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly J. Sandford

customer_reviews.title: FIRGE
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love my standmixer. I have used it every weekend since I've purchased it, making an assortment of breads, noodles, cookies, meringues, and sauces. The machine is easy to operate and clean. It comes with a whisk, paddle, and dough hook. I love the suction cups on the bottom of the machine that keeps it stabilized when it's in use. Having used the pricier KitchenAid mixers in the past, I can confidently say that this is a serious contender!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Yin

customer_reviews.title: Does an excellent job, just may not last forever.
customer_reviews.text: Good mixer. Gets the job done as well as a $300 Kitchenaide. So why the difference in price? It is louder and lighter which means the transmission and motor are not as well made. It probably wouldn't last as long as a Kitchenaid. However, if you do not use it daily, it should last long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Strongwood

customer_reviews.title: Works but not made of good quality...
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered came broken.,. Sent it back ordered another one....then one of the buttons broke the first time I used it., So now I have to hold it down every time I go to mix something.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this mixer
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this mixer. Works as it should and extends the satisfaction I have for the Hamilton Beach brand. Slowly all of my kitchen appliances are being replaced by said brand.
customer_reviews.author: ScottLS

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Not the best to be honest.. you have to put pressure on the top to make sure it’s mixing properly and even then it still don’t mix well.. a month after I bought this the piece broke off the side where it keeps it locked in and shortly after so did the second piece so it’s practically not useful..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inferior Product
customer_reviews.text: Used it only about 6 times and it broke. I was not satisfied with the customer service from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Maksem

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 kitchen aids and for the price this works as well as either of them
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ziesig

customer_reviews.title: You can tell it's lower quality than the more expensive ones but so far works great. Not bad for less than half the price ...
customer_reviews.text: Use it on a weekly base. You can tell it's lower quality than the more expensive ones but so far works great. Not bad for less than half the price of the more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Workes as expected. It is not a $600 machine but works good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife as a replacement. She doesn't make bread. But likes it very well. If you are looking for a stand mixer that does a good job this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer
customer_reviews.text: My daughter suggested it. She owns two Kitchen Aide mixers and does a lot of baking. She had done the research and the read the reviews about the Hamilton Beach. She said it was a great mixer for the money. I received it for my birthday. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ken and Regina Smith

customer_reviews.title: Almost
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to add products to it while mixing, the attachments do not mix bottom or incorporate the sides enough, it can get going yet sounds like its going to go to the moon, it can not handle a thick batter of any kind! it bogs down... eventually it will blow the motor. this is a nice mixer for someone doing small light batters... nothing like peanut butter cookies, chocolate chip, ect... good for the moment yet need to upgrade use this for light mixes.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it a short time, but so far I find it to be very high quality for the price range. It certainly perforns as well as a pricey Kitchenaid and will serve the average baker quite well. It is very well built of quality materials. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Love my mixer
customer_reviews.text: Love my mixer. It is the right size for what I needed to make bread, cookies and other baked goods. The attachments are easy to attach and remove. The base is great too in the size and ease of cleaning after usage.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: It works just as well as more expensive brands
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this mixer and it works as good as more expensive brand and it is light to carry or move around. I have no cons about this mixer. I am very happy with it and would recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne A. Sahakian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the occasional user
customer_reviews.text: I love this mixer and it was a fraction of the cost (and size) of a Kitchen Aid. We use this for the occasional cake, brownies and mashed potatoes. Easy to use and clean. Had it for a year and still very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Pete B

customer_reviews.title: Great for non-professionals
customer_reviews.text: I love this mixer! Such a good price. It does everything I need it to and probably more. I'm not an avid cooker or baker, but so far it has handled everything I've thrown its way from fudge to pizza dough. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the splash guard and the ease of control of ...
customer_reviews.text: It works very well. I like the splash guard and the ease of control of speed with the dial. I wish the bowl was as large as the one I had before. I would buy this again as long as it lasts more than ten years.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Reidner

customer_reviews.title: This Is Not for Heavy Duty Use
customer_reviews.text: Had this product for a year, used it 3 times and now it is broken. Motor doesn’t engage to turn mixer anymore. Don’t waste your time with this unless you are whisking eggs or pancakes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this mixer!
customer_reviews.text: This mixer works great! I recently received a KitchenAid mixer, so my daughter inherited this one. The only real difference in this mixer and my KitchenAid is that my KitchenAid has a larger bowl (which I sometimes need around the holidays when I am making big batches of cookies, cakes, etc ...) and I can get attachments for my KitchenAid.
customer_reviews.author: James McArthur

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money & get something better
customer_reviews.text: I had this a total of 3 months. I would not recommend it. The button you press to tilt the head came completely out! Also it does not reach the bottom of the bowl so you have to do a lot of scraping to make sure everything mixes together correctly. I would just spend the extra money for a kitchen aid, which is what i had to do.
customer_reviews.author: Gio

customer_reviews.title: Last long
customer_reviews.text: Love this stand mixer. It sticks to the counter perfectly and you don’t have to worry it slip when the mixer is turned on. There is also a removable shield to prevent flours spilling out when it is turned on. Love that it can do dough, whipped cream, and many more. My aunt’s friend gave one for her many years ago and she said she is still using it. So I brought one for myself too because I felt it last long enough for this reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer
customer_reviews.text: My sister loved it. She said it made making her 7 UP cake a breeze. It made the texture so smooth in half the time of a hand mixer. Great deal and sturdy stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer  Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy duty mix, broke easily
customer_reviews.text: This is not a durable product, it only last me for less than a year and totally broken. It can only be used for light mix, such as eggs, but not for heavy duty one such as pasta or even pizza.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mixer
customer_reviews.text: Hamilton beach has listened to their customers on how to design this mixer. Room to add things a in bowl. Shield for wet mixing. And pics on unit to indicate which speed to use for what. Comes with all attachments. Very nice mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Bread kneading machine
customer_reviews.text: Got this specifically for the bread hook attachment as I was getting into quarantine bread-making. Works well for kneading the dough.
customer_reviews.author: Bitch™

customer_reviews.title: Made of cheap plastic which breaks with sparing use. Not recommended at all.
customer_reviews.text: The product was good as long as it did not break. The tiny plastic knobs that held the mixing bowl in place broke in as little as 2 years of sparing use. Also the depth of the mixing bowl was so deep that the blades did not reach the bottom. The ingredients do not mix well at the bottom of the bowl. I always hand mixed my ingredients. I regret not having invested in a good stand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Guddi

customer_reviews.title: One speed - Super fast
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work unfortunately. It only had one speed, which was 5 (the fastest). the flour went everywhere when i turned it on! I wrote to the support team and they never responded. I had to pay 180 dollars to ship it back to them in time to get a refund. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: dean kenny`

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought it not more than one and half month, it doesn't work. The "On" button stuck in and never come out. Reported it for repairing, no one replied. Just used it no more than 10 time.........Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: zhuo li

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I really like this item, it is easy to use and clean. I have been used for make cake and bread. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a year of use
customer_reviews.text: Broken 1 year later. We used it maybe 15 times and that was in the last 3 months and it quit working.
customer_reviews.author: Veruka

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a month
customer_reviews.text: It worked for a month. I used it for mixing dough for bread and pasta, and probably used it for less than 20 times. Then it broke, wouldn’t be able to move a very soft dough around. When it worked, it was loud. Loud enough that every time I needed to use it, I moved it to a bathroom and close the door. I guess this is why it’s cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Xuemei Li

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing so far made biscuits and mash potatoes with ease I’m going to test it tomorrow on a pizza dough and leave an updated review
customer_reviews.author: Tai's Amazing Profile

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom for Christmas and she still hasn’t used it or will let anyone else use it, but it’s a great size and looks fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Dajah

customer_reviews.title: It's fine
customer_reviews.text: It works, but just feels cheap. I had to return it because it stopped working after a week (but I don't think that is a normal thing. I just got unlucky). For the price, I'd recommend just spending a little more on a Kitchen Aid stand mixer. The smallest of those go on pretty good sales.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Diliberto

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: Looks great easy to use has three attachments one for wiping one for bread and one for everything else
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Starting Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer when I first started my cookie business and I love it! It is better for mixing smaller batches. When Im mixing my regular batches of dough, it seems to grind a bit so I fear I'm wearing it out a bit faster than I'd like. I would definitely recommend it to a hobby baker!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value in this price range
customer_reviews.text: It's not commercial quality; that would cost a lot more. It's working just fine for me. I am very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Novice gardener

customer_reviews.title: My new bestfriend
customer_reviews.text: I love my mixer, pull it out every Sunday to bake a pound cake. It's extremely easy to use, and mixing is a breeze. It reaches the entire bowl, not leaving anything behind. And is just as easy to clean. Best purchase ever.
customer_reviews.author: Kea Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Great starter stand up mixer
customer_reviews.text: I've used the mixer a handful of times now since purchasing it. Overall I think it's a great starter stand up mixer. It's not super heavy duty but if you're on a budget and looking for something for casual baking this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but well made
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it yet, but it seems like an excellent product and is light compared to most mixers.
customer_reviews.author: Jacques

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Like everything about it simplifies the process of making tea cakes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bowl warped in dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: This mixer was great until it came out of the dishwasher with the bottom warped presumably by the hot water. Unable to affix the metal bowl to the stand the entire thing became useless and Hamilton Beach does not have a replacement bowl in stock. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Adam L Winner

customer_reviews.title: My Hamilton mixer
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is an excellent investment. Glad that I purchase it. It works perfectly fine and easy to handle. It came so fast to my house when my friend ordered the same one in her zip code 40216 and couldn’t get it. She had to cancel it.
customer_reviews.author: Josuee P.

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. I was leery that there was no handle but it's turned out to be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Richerson

customer_reviews.title: It gets entire bowl coverage and we love it!
customer_reviews.text: This mixer works very well and is a fraction of the cost of other big name ones. It gets entire bowl coverage and we love it!
customer_reviews.author: brody

customer_reviews.title: I would purchase again and have recommended it to friends as an alternative to Kitchen Aid.
customer_reviews.text: I loved that the mixer weighs about half that of the Kitchen Aid which is why I wouldn’t buy it. The mixing motion is the same, however the size of the bowl is slightly smaller. It does have a shield though which is worth using when adding flour to the batter. It’s also more compact and stores easily.
customer_reviews.author: Host2

customer_reviews.title: Mixer
customer_reviews.text: This product is ok, but the beater often falls off while using mixer. I bought it as a back-up to my Kitchen Aide mixer. It’s noisy, but ok, I don’t think I’d buy it again. Doesn’t seem to mix cakes well and I’m a huge baker.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: and so far I am very pleased with this one
customer_reviews.text: Waited a long time to purchase a mixer, and so far I am very pleased with this one! The price was great compared to other top models, so I was a little skeptical, but no shortcomings that I have yet to notice. Used it about 5 or 6 times so far and am very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: romeo63

customer_reviews.title: Good mixer for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the large bowl and the orbital mixing action. I've made chocolate chip cookies and dinner rolls so far and love it. One needs to be judicious when adding flour as it may sometimes pop out of the bowl if the mixer is moving too quickly. I would definitely recommend this mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Doug from RI

customer_reviews.title: Great machine and price!
customer_reviews.text: This stand mixer is as good or better as any of the top brands that cost 3-4x more. Great price!
customer_reviews.author: GiGi916

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love love it! well packed, great product, great seller!
customer_reviews.author: Candace Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works just as good as the Kitchen Aid in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is absolutely incredible! I used it all the time! It fits perfectly on my counter and does not take up much space at all. Works just as good as the Kitchen Aid in my opinion! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Craft

customer_reviews.title: Great Working Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Got this mixer for myself. It works just as well as the more expensive models. Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after three uses
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for the first two uses, then on the third it broke down. Pass this one by and spend a few dollars more for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Miller

customer_reviews.title: I loved my new stand mixer it works like a charm ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved my new stand mixer it works like a charm for the price of the kitchen aid i would buy this every time. I recommend this to anyone needing a mixer.
customer_reviews.author: valenting

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, good quality product, easy to use, it does everything it says it does. 5*****
customer_reviews.author: ELIUD ITHIER

customer_reviews.title: Too fast
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this a couple times. It works well if you need it to go fast. This machine is not capable of going at a speed lower than 7. It’s either off or 7+. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The wife finally got the countertop mixer she wanted...now I have diabetes and have gained 100lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie

customer_reviews.title: Good mixer
customer_reviews.text: This mixer has been great. I'm very glad I purchased this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice stand mixer
customer_reviews.text: Quality product, but my only complaint is that it's not heavy enough so it starts jumping around when it's at high speed.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Gor

customer_reviews.title: Button for lowering mixer got stuck in inward position first time I used it
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed. The very first time I used the machine the button that lifts the arm got stuck in the inward position and I ended up having to hold the machine arm down while the mixer was on.
customer_reviews.author: cindy gore

customer_reviews.title: I’m so happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.text: Why didn’t I buy this sooner!!! I threw out my hand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Mixer does the job and has not disappoint. Since it isn't as big fits well on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Duggan

customer_reviews.title: Good starter stand mixer
customer_reviews.text: Works great.. Only issue is the mixing paddle doesn't reach the very bottom side area, more scrapping than I'm used to. Good starter stand mixer at affordable price. If you plan on doing a lot of mixing go ahead and invest in a KitchenAid or other high quality mixer, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t quite do what I wanted it to.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that most things i’ve mixed in the bowl stick to the sides. Unlike my last mixmaster I cannot hold a knife at the side to get it to fall towards the middle. 6ou must turn it off and lift the mixing tool up.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I have had so much trouble trying to keep the paddle and whisk in the mixer while in use, I have tried everything possible but they still fall right out!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top Rated by Consumer Reports - Agree
customer_reviews.text: After much research we found this product and love it. The price was great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best kitchen appliance ever purchased. Seriously buy one, it will change your baking life!
customer_reviews.author: zhobin tamjidi

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t want to commit to a kitchen aid- due to the cost. I’m a beginning baker. Not even sure if baking has taken a liking to me. I would recommend this stand mixer. It has good power and very easy to clean. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Carmela Evangelista

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach Electric Stand Mixer, 4 Quart Stainless Bowl, 7 Speeds, Tilt-Head, Dough Hook, Whisk and Flat Beater, Splash Guard, 300 Watts, Black (63390)
product_meta.description: This Hamilton Beach stand mixer can do everything from whip delicate meringues to mix sticky pizza dough. It has the same rotating mixing action as KitchenAid stand mixers* - which means complete bowl coverage with no scraping necessary. A tilt-up head lets you add ingredients and change attachments quickly.
feature_bullets: SAME MIXING ACTION AS KITCHENAID STAND MIXERS*: Don't pay hundreds of dollars more than you need to for the same mixing performance. Get the same planetary mixing action as the high-priced brand and spend your savings on fancy ingredients instead.

THOROUGH MIXING AND COMPLETE BOWL COVERAGE. As you mix, each attachment rotates around the entire bowl as it spins at your selected speed. This planetary mixing action ensures that ingredients are mixed thoroughly and provides complete bowl coverage.
POWERS THROUGH THE THICKEST DOUGH AND MAINTAINS CONSTANT SPEED. No matter how thick or heavy your ingredients are, the powerful 300 watt motor of this kitchen stand mixer maintains constant speed.
PROVIDES MIXING VERSATILITY — DOUGH HOOK, WHISK AND FLAT BEATER INCLUDED: 3 versatile attachments let you do everything from kneading pizza dough to mixing cookie dough and whipping cream.

DURABLE STAINLESS STEEL 4 QUART BOWL WITH REMOVABLE SPLATTER SHIELD. The stainless steel bowl is designed to withstand year after year of mixing and includes a removable splatter shield that fits on top when needed. Dishwasher safe for easy cleanup.
* KITCHENAID is a registered trademark of Whirlpool Corporation. Use of the KITCHENAID trademark does not imply any affiliation with or endorsement by Whirlpool Corporation.
